review_title: CNA work at a local rural Hospital setting

pros: Great patient population to work with, close to the beach, great team of staff to work with.
cons: Not great pay for a full time job as a CNA

pros: Benefits. Wear scrubs.. 4 day work week
cons: Mgmt is not supportive, they apply rules for some and not others. There is a clique mentality. The gossip and rumor spreading as well as outright lies and bullying is allowed. It's really unbelievable.

pros: Supporting environment and great benefits.

pros: Good benefits and pay is alright

pros: Great coworkers self scheduling great benefits.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Mobile, AL

cons: - Overall workload and unrealistic expectations on patient care

job_title: Human Resources Representative in Mobile, AL
pros: The job itself is simple, you receive sometimes little to full training on the tasks at hand. The benefits are well payed for by the company. You might have a shot at a great leadership team.
cons: Your hours are usually cut and dry, absolutely no overtime unless you’re ordered with no notice to work overtime or “volun-told” to volunteer on campus (sometimes unpaid). Your Director and Vice President will be completely removed from your day-to-day logistics, despite potentially sharing an office, that expectations will be unrealistic but manager and team leader will try to soften the blow and show their appreciation. Your demise will likely be lack of pay despite having one or more degrees (because they surely aren’t hiring you without one minimum) and the workload of 2-3 individuals you will have because they keep eliminating positions and reducing the budget while increasing the number of employees.

pros: You see a lot of things to prepare you for any medical career
cons: You’ll never advance or be any better

pros: Good environment to work in
cons: Not enough pay for the job you do

job_title: Registered Nurse Case Manager in Fairhope, AL
pros: flexible work schedule and great benefits
cons: not paid enough money, paying travelers well over $100 per hour but have not increased pay to employees who stayed throughout the pandemic

job_title: Insurance and Accounting Coordinator in Mobile, AL
pros: Easy relax work environment hybrid
cons: Pay not enough help Eto

pros: I can’t speak for every floor, but there is supportive management with an open door policy. Almost all coworkers are supportive. There is typically a collective feeling of teamwork.
cons: Unfortunately during COVID we are all struggling however it doesn’t seem that the hospital is doing much for retention. We take extra more critical patients aren’t compensated. They also don’t ask if you want overtime you just get scheduled.

pros: Will get plenty of diverse experience
cons: Poor work life balance, frequent long hours.

pros: Great benefits, pay and people.

pros: Flexible, low stress environment, great coworkers

review_title: Great place, not so great management
pros: Great people to work for. Flexible scheduling. Great work environment
cons: No communication from floor management. Floor management will tell you one thing, then do the opposite

pros: Leniency on work schedule parameters
cons: Department politics are absolutely ridiculous.

job_title: IT Team Lead in Mobile, AL
pros: Health insurance, Leadership, Time off
cons: Lack of project management and rushed projects with impossible deadlines.

pros: Great benefits and lots of jobs opportunities
cons: Very top heavy. Difficult to get things done. I don't feel like they appreciate the lower level workers and it's apparent with their high turn over rate. Their HR department does not help front end workers, they are their to help managers and higher ups only.

pros:
PTO hours
Parking Deck for employees
cons:
Management
No advancement opportunities for non-nursing staff

pros: Better pay than most other companies in the area. Annual raises are given at your managers discretion and based on your performance evaluation and the systems finances. Although managers will likely receive their end of year bonus, annual raises are unlikely for regular employees in 2020 due to COVID and the health systems financial instability.
cons:
DRAMA - everyone talks about everyone; there is a tattle tale mentality behind the systems "core values" where they want you to report even the most minor concerns... and if there is an error or problem, BEWARE! Everyone will know about it.

ETO - "earned time off" - you have to use accrued time off to take a holiday off. If you do not have the time accrued (say you were hired just before a holiday) you don't get paid. This is true for everyone, even professional employees.

RESOURCES - inadequate resources for nurses and all clinical staff are overworked because the system is so understaffed. Conditions are GROSS. Many units smell terribly of urine and are outdated, while higher administration is comfortable in their newly remodeled suites.

BEWARE - If you're a solid good worker, it still won't be enough to succeed at Infirmary. Managers are solely concerned about their end of year bonus. Furloughs and RIFs were part of the systems COVID response. There was no structure to the process. It's completely based on favoritism.

pros: Nice coworkers and friendly community.
cons:
Low pay for very busy flow
Management

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Daphne, AL
pros: pay pay pay pay pay
cons: upper management sucks stay away run

pros: The only Pros are SOME of the employees ( Nurses,techs,maintenance etc) and the convenient location in Mobile Alabama. At one time it was the pay but no amount of pay is worth what you have to put up with there.
cons: The administrative body of this healthcare system are self righteous,egotistical and Idiotic.They are so rotten and corrupt that they have to rely on intimidation and coercion to maintain  enough employees to keep the doors open.The degree of ineptitude of the managers,supervisors,human resources personnel and administrative staff  is unprecedented and completely mind boggling. What kind of hospital would make a statement to new hire nurses and professional healthcare employees  "as a employee of MIMC you will do whatever you are told. If we tell you to wash the CEOs car you will wash the CEOs car!" and . " as a MIMC employee you do not have a right to a lunch break; this is a courtesy that we provide" what a horrible way to treat employees!! How can a hospital as awful as MIMC keep their accreditation? Where is JCAHO? Where is the Alabama State Dept of Health?

review_title: Take the good with the bad
pros: There was a lot of schedule flexibility, good benefits while working there, convenience of services.
cons: Horrible short & long term disability benefits and felt abandoned by MIMC when I had to get on it.  There are loads of problems with management & the executive administration...too many to list.  There was always some kind of coworker conflict when I worked inhouse there and management did little to nothing to address these issues, which made the workplace hostile at times.  Those at the bottom of the rung had no power & no "say" in things which I feel was unfair.

pros: Strives for excellence service in a cost effective manner. Great benefit package.
cons: Not a huge fan of services being contracted out of the system to other companies who often do not demonstrate system core values & mission.

review_title: Hospital System is not IT Focused
pros:
Work family environment
Infirmary Health is a leading hospital in the area
cons:
IT is not a priority at the leadership level, but often seen as a roadblock
Changing priorities
No project leadership
Promotions are based on years there, not work quality or effort
Salary ranges are not in line with other similar cities in Alabama
Salary ranges are not in line with other hospital systems

pros: Stable company, quick turnover to allow for promotions
cons: Mandatory uniforms with no subsidies for my department, high turn over, no standard of business operations (ex the admissions department did not have a standard operating procedure manual, but punished employees for performing duties the way they were trained.) Generally no care about the patient unless money figures into it.

review_title: Looking for a busy hospital that I may perform my skills of 7 years.
pros: I worked on 3N which is a surgical orthopedic floor and we had great team players that always put the patients safety first.
cons: Getting close to the patients and family members when God calls them home.

review_title: Great executive vision, poor project execution by middle management
pros: Culture, community-oriented, good executive leadership, excellent effort to maintain and improve patient safety, skilled operational staff
cons: Low salary, reactive, unorganized, staff not valued

pros: Good working environment. Enjoy my staff and manager.
cons: Nothing . Everything is fine I just need an extra income to support family

pros: really good benefits and 401K
cons: difficult to move upward internally

pros: Insurance is good.  Clinic financial rep has no clue about his/her position.
cons: Pay sucks... You don't advance unless you kiss upper managements butt.

pros: Salaries relatively competitive for the area.
cons: Limited potential for career growth or advancement. History of micromangement.

review_title: Good job, slim chance for advancement
pros: Great patient care is given at the Infirmary hospitals.
cons: Slim chance for advancement in the workplace.

pros: Many settings to choose from
cons: Discontinued matching 401K, decreased person to person communications. Employees feel like a number.

review_title: Over all good place to work
pros: Coworkers worked hard and as a team. Good benefits
cons: Managers tried to micromanage staff

pros: Great place to work, great benefits and salary compensations.
cons: No  issues to report about the Infirmary Health
